data.title: Can't go wrong with the Clancy!
data.text: Have eaten their at least 50 times and have never had anything that wasn't delicious.  The staff and owner are awesome too!

data.title: great food and service
data.text: my family has been coming here for years. we love the food and the service. my out of town relatives always make a point to stop in when they are in town.

data.title: Simply Sublime
data.text: My favorite sandwich here is the Veggie Smitty, which has cream cheese and cheddar cheese with shredded lettuce on it. This place also serves a slushy Lemonade and Portland Punch, which is delicious! The punch flavor reminds me of the berry punch at Knott's Berry Farm in SoCal. The service here was prompt and very friendly so I plan to return often.

data.title: Our family's favorite sandwich shop!
data.text: This is a favorite of the whole family. Anytime we are in central Beaverton on a Saturday the kids always ask to go to the ‘sub shop’. It is often busy, but definitely worth the wait. My daughter likes the turkey on the sub-roll, I am partial to the Veggie Clancy. Six-inch sandwich will fill you up! Sometimes we forget and get the 12-inch, and always seem to take some home! Everything is fresh and made on the spot. Everyone working in the place always seems good natured and helpful. There is plenty of room to eat inside and tables on the sidewalk on the nice days. Definitely stop by and give them a try if you are in the area.

data.title: best Rueben sandwich
data.text: The sandwiches are delicious a menu with mostly classic sandwiches.  The rueben is juicy and delicious with sauerkraut, cheese and corned beef.  The bread is my problem it doesn't stand up, eat those delicious reasonably priced sandwiches quickly.  Good tuna salad but again the bread selection doesn't contain all the moisture .Quality fillings, horrible parking.

data.title: Best Fresh sub sandwich around simply amazing!
data.text:
This Place ROCKS.............

My wife and I have been coming here it seems like forever now at least once a every couple of weeks if not every week . To tell you the truth it is the best sandwich I have ever had in a shop.  I can make a pretty good second at home but that's to much trouble. 

When we first came in I ordered a foot long thinking hey I'm a big guy and I'm hungry, my wife tried to tell me a 6" would be fine but I said  
"oh no way"  and got a six car foot long.  Now a six car is turkey and ham with four other meats mostly salamis with all the fix-ins, and I mean fix-ins. They are  lettuce, tomato, onion, oil and vinegar, I also like mayo and man I think salt and pepper with a pickle. Well I ate it but let me tell you I now get the 6" not the 12".  

Chuck the guy that builds the behemoths and the owner always remembers my name and has a great attitude even tho I think he never stops making sandwiches from like 11am til around 1pm but is always friendly.

The soup is good I have had the french onion and the cheddar broccoli. I come here for the sandwiches and bring everyone I know here to make sure they get the experience of the 
Beaverton Sub Station.

You should try it and make sure you are hungry because man it is worthy of the taste.

Big Mike

data.title: Best sandwich in town.
data.text: This restaurant has the best sandwiches in town, bar none. They come on nice hearty sub rolls and are piled high with meat. A 6 incher is plenty big enough for me and I don't even need chips to go with it because it's so filling.

data.title: Best Subs Around
data.text: If you want a "homemade" sub, then this is the place for you. It's nothing like Subway and I'm glad. They have a daily specials which is nice and the food is consistently great every time. I wish the sub shop was closer to my office so I could enjoy it everyday. 🙁

data.title: Substation is Always Great
data.text: Substation may look like a whole in the wall but I have been eating there for over 20 years.  I love the Turkey Clancey and the Turkey Smittey on pita bread.

data.title: Personalized, good sandwiches
data.text: Local Sub shop with many food combinations, 1 item, 2 items, 3 or 4. We had pastrami and wheat, good and tasty,,but we expected a roll, not sliced bread. They make an effort to use your name, and, I hear are good at remembering names.

data.title: Tasty large portions for cheap
data.text: We've been looking for a good sandwich shop and this was quite good. Fun atmosphere and our kids enjoyed playing with the toy trains. My husband was full after a 6" which is unusual. Sandwiches cost $5.25 - $11.25. Most people would be satisfied after a $5.50 sandwich. They also have breakfast sandwiches anytime, as well as coffee and milkshakes. A must try for any sandwich lover.

data.title: Solid food, lovely staff, A+++
data.text: Here it is. Hand written signs, friendly people, sandwiches are straight ahead and delicious. Highly recommended. I mean, it's a train themed sub shop next to a train track. Perfect

data.title: Fun and friendly staff turn out the perfect  sandwich just for you!
data.text: Parking can be tricky at times but send one person to pick up orders for the whole office.  I usually save half for later as the portions are generous!

data.title: Great sammy
data.text: This is an awesome little sandwich shop in historic downtown Beaverton. We were just passing through and stopped in for lunch. On the proprietor's advice we had our sammys on baguette style buns. Basic salad on the side and eclectic, train- fish- and baseball-themed decor. We saw bike delivery guys coming and going, so obviously it's a popular spot for locals.

data.title: Hometown at its best
data.text:
Don't know what I can say that hasn't been said before.  This is the kind of establishment you'd want to find in a small town while on a road trip.  Locally owned for 35 years, it's widely known for its sandwiches, bagels, super inexpensive coffee, and camaraderie.  My favorite is the Clancy w/meat, avocado, cheese, etc.  The place can get really, really busy during lunch, so phoning in an order is a good idea.
It truly offers a better and tastier selection than any chain.

Ecletic decor adds to its charm.  The owners do one thing--operate a storefront business--and do it right.  It's in Old Town Beaverton & parking can be  problematic close by.  There's a public lot 2+ blocks away, though.  They're closed Sundays and holidays.

data.title: Best "old school" subs.
data.text: This charming little sub shop is just what you want. Great, quick service with yummy food. I have only had their subs, but the other food looks so good, too. I especially love the sub bread!

data.title: Great sandwiches and atmosphere
data.text:
This place is amazing. The food is terrific, with decent prices for large portions. To go with the train station theme, there are lots of train memorabilia hanging on the walls.

I had their veggie Clancy sandwich and a salted caramel toasted hazlenut shake -- both were yummy!

data.title: GREAT TASTING SANDWICH -- I'LL BE BACK WITH THE WIFE
data.text: Recommended by one of my clients.  So while working the Portland Area this trip I drove some 4 miles out of the way to give it a try.  Don't let the décor or the un-organized paper menu frighten you away.  Friendly staff and tasty food will be found here.  Prices are right also.  About 6 people in line which moved quickly but there was about a 15 minute wait for my to-go sandwich, it is lunch time.  Great fresh bread with lots of meat.  Next time I will ask for more condiments though, it was a little dry for me.  Prep area is really small, (sorry, as a PR Person, I see these things) but they put out a good sandwich so I guess they could make them on a breadboard and all would be well!  While waiting I saw the delivery guy load up a plastic cube full of orders and go riding off into the lunch hour to deliver off his bicycle.  Over all pleasant experience, sort of old Americana.  Great little place, just allow a few extra minutes at lunch hour but do try it, I firmly believe you will enjoy the food and the experience.

data.title: Great Subs!!
data.text: Best subs in town. Old fashioned, great tasting, good variety. Good salads too. Been eating there for years.

data.title: Good Old Fashioned Sub Sandwiches
data.text: This old sub shop in the heart of Beaverton is one of the best sub sandwiches I have had. Limited variety, but all good. A must visit place if you are in Beaverton.
